member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.ConnectionCredentials
member.summary: Connection credentials.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.ConnectionCredentials.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionToken.
The connection token.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.ConnectionCredentials.Expiry
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Expiry.
The expiration of the token.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateParticipantConnection operation. Creates the participant's connection. Note that ParticipantToken is used for invoking this API instead of ConnectionToken.
The participant token is valid for the lifetime of the participant â€“ until the they are part of a contact.
The response URL for WEBSOCKET Type has a connect expiry timeout of 100s. Clients must manually connect to the returned websocket URL and subscribe to the desired topic.
For chat, you need to publish the following on the established websocket connection:
{"topic":"aws/subscribe","content":{"topics":["aws/chat"]}}
Upon websocket URL expiry, as specified in the response ConnectionExpiry parameter, clients need to call this API again to obtain a new websocket URL and perform the same steps as before.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionRequest.ParticipantToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParticipantToken.
Participant Token as obtained from StartChatContact API response.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Type of connection information required.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateParticipantConnection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionResponse.ConnectionCredentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionCredentials.
Creates the participant's connection credentials. The authentication token associated with the participant's connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionResponse.Websocket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Websocket.
Creates the participant's websocket connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.DisconnectParticipantRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DisconnectParticipant operation. Disconnects a participant. Note that ConnectionToken is used for invoking this API instead of ParticipantToken.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.DisconnectParticipantRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.DisconnectParticipantRequest.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionToken.
The authentication token associated with the participant's connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.DisconnectParticipantResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DisconnectParticipant operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetTranscript operation. Retrieves a transcript of the session. Note that ConnectionToken is used for invoking this API instead of ParticipantToken.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionToken.
The authentication token associated with the participant's connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.ContactId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContactId.
The contactId from the current contact chain for which transcript is needed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in the page. Default: 10.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token. Use the value returned previously in the next subsequent request to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.ScanDirection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScanDirection.
The direction from StartPosition from which to retrieve message. Default: BACKWARD when no StartPosition is provided, FORWARD with StartPosition.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.SortOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SortOrder.
The sort order for the records. Default: DESCENDING.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptRequest.StartPosition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartPosition.
A filtering option for where to start.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetTranscript operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptResponse.InitialContactId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitialContactId.
The initial contact ID for the contact.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token. Use the value returned previously in the next subsequent request to retrieve the next set of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.GetTranscriptResponse.Transcript
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Transcript.
The list of messages in the session.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item
member.summary: An item - message or event - that has been sent.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.AbsoluteTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbsoluteTime.
The time when the message or event was sent.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
The content of the message or event.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The type of content of the item.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.DisplayName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisplayName.
The chat display name of the sender.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the item.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.ParticipantId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParticipantId.
The ID of the sender in the session.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.ParticipantRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParticipantRole.
The role of the sender. For example, is it a customer, agent, or system.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Item.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Type of the item: message or event.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SendEvent operation. Sends an event. Note that ConnectionToken is used for invoking this API instead of ParticipantToken.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventRequest.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionToken.
The authentication token associated with the participant's connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventRequest.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
The content of the event to be sent (for example, message text). This is not yet supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The content type of the request. Supported types are:
application/vnd.amazonaws.connect.event.typing
application/vnd.amazonaws.connect.event.connection.acknowledged

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SendEvent operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventResponse.AbsoluteTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbsoluteTime.
The time when the event was sent.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendEventResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the response.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SendMessage operation. Sends a message. Note that ConnectionToken is used for invoking this API instead of ParticipantToken.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageRequest.ConnectionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionToken.
The authentication token associated with the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageRequest.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
The content of the message.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The type of the content. Supported types are text/plain.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SendMessage operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageResponse.AbsoluteTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbsoluteTime.
The time when the message was sent.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.SendMessageResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the message.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.StartPosition
member.summary: A filtering option for where to start. For example, if you sent 100 messages, start with message 50.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.StartPosition.AbsoluteTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AbsoluteTime.
The time in ISO format where to start.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.StartPosition.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the message or event where to start.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.StartPosition.MostRecent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MostRecent.
The start position of the most recent message where you want to start.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Websocket.ConnectionExpiry
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionExpiry.
The URL expiration timestamp in ISO date format.
It's specified in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ. For example, 2019-11-08T02:41:28.172Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.Websocket.Url
member.summary:

The URL of the websocket.

member.name: T:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.AmazonConnectParticipantClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ConnectParticipant
Amazon Connect is a cloud-based contact center solution that makes it easy to set up and manage a customer contact center and provide reliable customer engagement at any scale.
Amazon Connect enables customer contacts through voice or chat.
The APIs described here are used by chat participants, such as agents and customers.

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.AmazonConnectParticipantClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonConnectParticipantClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.AmazonConnectParticipantClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonConnectParticipantClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.AmazonConnectParticipantClient.CreateParticipantConnectionAsync(Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.CreateParticipantConnectionRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Creates the participant's connection. Note that ParticipantToken is used for invoking this API instead of ConnectionToken.
The participant token is valid for the lifetime of the participant â€“ until the they are part of a contact.
The response URL for WEBSOCKET Type has a connect expiry timeout of 100s. Clients must manually connect to the returned websocket URL and subscribe to the desired topic.
For chat, you need to publish the following on the established websocket connection:
{"topic":"aws/subscribe","content":{"topics":["aws/chat"]}}
Upon websocket URL expiry, as specified in the response ConnectionExpiry parameter, clients need to call this API again to obtain a new websocket URL and perform the same steps as before.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateParticipantConnection service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateParticipantConnection service method, as returned by ConnectParticipant.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
This exception occurs when there is an internal failure in the Amazon Connect service.
The request was denied due to request throttling.
The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by Amazon Connect.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateParticipantConnection Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ConnectParticipant.AmazonConnectParticipantClient.DisconnectParticipantAsync(Amazon.ConnectParticipant.Model.DisconnectParticipantRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Disconnects a participant. Note that ConnectionToken is used for invoking this API instead of ParticipantToken.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DisconnectParticipant service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DisconnectParticipant service method, as returned by ConnectParticipant.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
This exception occurs when there is an internal failure in the Amazon Connect service.
The request was denied due to request throttling.
The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by Amazon Connect.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DisconnectParticipant Operation
